New Records: Willy Adames tied the major league record with his 13th three-run homer of the season
Adames homered for the fifth consecutive game, matching the Brewers record shared by Jeromy Burnitz (1997) and Eric Thames (2017)
Key Match Events: Willy Adames hit a three-run homer on his 29th birthday to put the Brewers ahead 3-0 in the first
Jackson Chourio hit a grand slam in the sixth inning
Rhys Hoskins also homered for the Brewers
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Adames said he got emotional after hitting a three-run homer on his 29th birthday
Adames is hitting.255 with a career-high 99 RBI, one more than in 2022
Milwaukee manager Pat Murphy said it's almost shocking when Adames comes to the plate and doesn't hit a home run with two guys on
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers hit a two-run homer, three-run homer, and grand slam in the same game for the first time since July 1, 2022
Pedro Pag√©s hit a pair of solo home runs off Peralta, increasing his season home run total to five
Others: Freddy Peralta (10-7) won his third consecutive decision, allowing three runs and six hits in 5 1/3 innings
Bryan Hudson and Joe Ross followed with hitless relief
The Cardinals dropped back to.500 at 69-69
